channel.title: Finding domains only with the base name
channel.description:
How could I? Let's say I wanted to find domains with the base mitb. If I have other info, such as the language of the domain[en], the forum type[vB], would it be easier to find?
For example, typing inurl:"keyword" on Google. But it gives me loads and not just the base -._
Is it also possible to snatch an users browsing history and then send that to a remote site? This would be one solution to my problem.

item.title: Finding domains only with the base name
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So you want to type in ‘moparisthebest.com’ and get results for moparisthebest.com, www.moparisthebest.com, fakesubdomainhere.moparisthebest.com etc? You can do that in google by just using: site:moparisthebest.com

Is that what you wanted?

Read full topic
item.source: Finding domains only with the base name
